title: Considering What to Invest When Starting an Airbnb
summary: Starting an STR requires balancing three investments: heart (emotional commitment and differentiation), money (minimum $3,000 for a one-bedroom including furniture and photography), and time. The emotional investment and personal touch will set your property apart from competitors. Budget at least $3,000 for initial setup in a growing market.
keyInsight: Success in STR hosting requires emotional investment and differentiation, not just capital—your personal commitment is what will set you apart in a crowded market.

title: The Ins and Outs of Market Research When Starting an Airbnb
summary: Understanding local regulations is essential before launching an STR, as many cities are actively regulating short-term rentals. Thorough market research helps ensure legal compliance and proper positioning. Hosts should attend city council meetings and understand local laws before investing.
keyInsight: Area regulations are one of the biggest obstacles to STR success—verify legal compliance before making any property investments.

title: Pricing Your Airbnb: What You Need to Know
summary: Pricing is a constantly evolving aspect of STR management that requires ongoing attention and adjustment. Use Airbnb's pricing calculator and third-party tools like Beyond Pricing to optimize rates. Successful hosts treat pricing as a dynamic, not set-it-and-forget-it, responsibility.
keyInsight: Pricing requires constant attention and adjustment—it's not a one-time decision but an ongoing revenue optimization practice.

title: Improve Your Airbnb by Thinking Like a Guest
summary: Successful STR hosts operate in the hospitality business, selling experiences beyond just space. Thinking proactively like a guest helps identify opportunities to enhance stays and justify premium pricing. This approach differentiates properties in crowded markets and increases revenue potential.
keyInsight: Luxury STRs succeed by selling unique experiences, not just space—adopt a proactive hospitality mindset to stand out and command higher rates.

title: The Importance of Getting Professional Photos for Your Airbnb Property
summary: Professional photography is the most important element of an STR listing, as it's the first impression potential guests receive. Quality images directly impact booking rates and guest expectations. Investing in professional photography is non-negotiable for competitive listings.
keyInsight: Professional photography is the single most important marketing investment for an STR—it's the primary driver of booking decisions.

title: Essential Tips for Cleaning Your Airbnb Property
summary: Cleanliness is one of the most frequent guest complaints yet one of the easiest standards to achieve consistently. Poor cleaning is a top reason guests report properties didn't meet expectations. Establishing rigorous cleaning protocols is essential for maintaining five-star reviews.
keyInsight: Cleanliness is the easiest differentiator to control and the most common complaint—make it non-negotiable to protect your reputation and reviews.

title: How to List Your Space on Airbnb
summary: This step-by-step walkthrough covers the technical process of creating an Airbnb listing, including required information, platform prompts, and safety requirements. Understanding the listing process helps avoid common mistakes and ensures compliance with platform standards. The episode includes references to Airbnb Plus checklist for quality benchmarks.
keyInsight: Understanding Airbnb's listing requirements and using resources like the Airbnb Plus checklist ensures your property meets platform standards from day one.

title: What it Takes to be a Superhosting Power Couple with Tia Brown and Kyle Brown
summary: This power couple shares how they built a successful two-person STR operation and used Airbnb income to finance additional real estate purchases and their wedding. They discuss taking action, managing operations as a team, and leveraging STR revenue for wealth building. Their story demonstrates how STR income can fund lifestyle and investment goals.
keyInsight: STR income can be strategically leveraged to finance real estate acquisitions and major life expenses when operations are efficient and cash flow is strong.

title: Properly: A Turnover Solution for Small Co-Hosts and Big Property Managers
summary: Properly provides turnover management solutions for hosts managing multiple properties or co-hosting arrangements. VP Tammi Sims, herself a Superhost, explains how the platform helps maintain consistent cleaning standards across portfolios. The service addresses a critical operational challenge for hosts scaling beyond one property.
keyInsight: Technology platforms like Properly enable hosts to maintain quality standards while scaling, solving the turnover management challenge that often limits growth.

title: Holiday Tips for Airbnb & Short-Term Rental Hosts
summary: This episode covers strategies for managing properties during holidays, including taking personal time off and creating memorable guest experiences during peak vacation periods. The hosts share mistakes to avoid based on their holiday horror stories. Balancing host availability with guest experience during holidays requires advance planning.
keyInsight: Strategic holiday planning allows hosts to maximize revenue during peak periods while also protecting personal time and creating standout guest experiences.

title: Convincing Your Partner to Airbnb
summary: Sarah's husband Nick discusses his initial hesitation about hosting strangers and what convinced him to support their STR business. The episode addresses the critical step of getting partner alignment before launching a short-term rental. Nick shares his evolution from skeptic to supporter of the STR industry.
keyInsight: Partner buy-in is essential before starting an STR business, requiring open communication about concerns and financial benefits.

title: Short-Term Renting Your RV or Travel Trailer
summary: Nick Karakaian returns to discuss using Outdoorsy and RVShare to rent out RVs as an alternative STR income stream. The episode explores platform diversification beyond traditional home rentals. This offers hosts ways to monetize dormant recreational vehicles.
keyInsight: RV rental platforms like Outdoorsy and RVShare offer STR hosts opportunities to diversify income streams beyond traditional property rentals.

title: All the Ways to Make Airbnb Your Side Hustle
summary: Annette and Sarah explore various ways to participate in the STR industry without owning property, including photography, turnover services, co-hosting, and staging. The episode demonstrates multiple entry points into the short-term rental business. It's valuable for understanding the full ecosystem of STR services.
keyInsight: You don't need to own property to earn income in the STR industry—opportunities exist in photography, turnover, co-hosting, and staging services.

title: How to Be Wheelchair & Handicap Compliant in a Short-Term Rental: ADA Compliance & Design
summary: LeAnne Lavender shares insights on making STR spaces accessible to guests with disabilities, drawing from personal experience after her husband's paralysis. The episode covers practical renovations and design considerations for ADA compliance. Understanding accessibility can expand your potential guest market and demonstrate inclusive hospitality.
keyInsight: Making your STR accessible to guests with disabilities expands your market and demonstrates superhost commitment to serving all guests.

title: Flipping Houses, Hosting on Airbnb, & Everything in Between
summary: Wendy Doris of FlippinWendy Design discusses the intersection of house flipping and short-term rentals. The episode explores how renovation skills and real estate investing complement STR hosting. Wendy shares design insights applicable to creating attractive rental properties.
keyInsight: House flipping skills and STR hosting are complementary businesses that leverage similar renovation and design expertise for maximum property value.

title: Coffee, Robes, Phone Chargers, Flowers, & Other Details That Will Make Your Airbnb Stand Out
summary: Tiffany Caliva of The Beach Lodge shares her journey to Superhost status and the specific details that make properties stand out, from quality coffee to robes and chargers. She discusses transforming a run-down property and using Instagram for marketing. The episode emphasizes that small, thoughtful touches create memorable guest experiences and drive bookings.
keyInsight: Attention to small luxury details like quality coffee, robes, and chargers differentiates your property and drives positive reviews and Instagram marketing success.

title: Funding Your Airbnb Investment Property
summary: Marc Kade of PrimeLending explains financing options for acquiring STR investment properties, covering lending strategies for both investors and personal homebuyers. The episode provides practical knowledge about securing funding to launch or expand an STR business. Understanding financing is essential for hosts looking to purchase dedicated rental properties.
keyInsight: Understanding specialized lending options for investment properties is critical for hosts looking to acquire dedicated STR properties rather than renting their primary residence.

title: How to Automate Your Airbnb & What it's Like to Airbnb Your Home When You Travel
summary: Cody Boyce shares how he automated his STR operations for free using Zapier while renting his personal home during business travel. The episode demonstrates practical automation strategies that save time and reduce manual tasks. Automation is especially valuable for hosts managing properties remotely or part-time.
keyInsight: Free automation tools like Zapier can streamline STR operations, making it feasible to rent your personal home while traveling with minimal manual management.

title: InnTown Stays: A Unique Short-Term Rental Business That Helps People Recovering from a Disaster
summary: BJ Allmon discusses InnTown Stays, a service providing temporary housing for people recovering from disasters, demonstrating a unique niche in the STR industry. The episode shows how STR platforms can address social needs while creating business opportunities. It highlights untapped market segments within short-term rentals.
keyInsight: Niche STR business models like disaster recovery housing demonstrate that significant opportunities still exist in underserved market segments of the short-term rental industry.

title: Best & Worst Cities for Airbnb: Making Money & Paying Your Mortgage with Short-Term Rentals
summary: Gillian Luce from Homes.com presents data on the best and worst cities for STR profitability, helping hosts strategically choose locations. The episode covers how short-term rentals can offset or cover mortgage payments. Location selection is a fundamental decision that determines long-term STR success and profitability.
keyInsight: Data-driven location selection based on STR profitability metrics is the most critical decision for new hosts looking to cover mortgages or generate significant income.

title: Kelly Rauch
summary: Kelly Rauch demonstrates how social media marketing launched a high-end rental in Mexico and increased repeat bookings. She shares strategies for using free Instagram and Facebook tools to build a rental brand and boost occupancy. Examples of successful Airbnb influencers are provided for inspiration.
keyInsight: Social media marketing is a free, powerful tool that can transform occupancy rates and create repeat guests for luxury short-term rentals.

title: Annette + Sarah
summary: This episode explores the flexible nature of co-hosting arrangements and what these partnerships can look like. The hosts explain that co-hosting is a 'choose-your-own-adventure' role that requires clear communication between partners. Various partnership models are discussed to help listeners structure their own arrangements.
keyInsight: Co-hosting partnerships are highly customizable and require upfront conversations to define roles and responsibilities for success.

title: Annette + Sarah
summary: The episode addresses common fears about property damage and theft, emphasizing these incidents happen rarely. Hosts share strategies to minimize damage costs and protect hosting status. The goal is to reassure new hosts not to let fear prevent them from entering the STR business.
keyInsight: Property damage happens far less frequently than feared, and proper protocols can minimize both financial impact and reputational damage.

title: Jennifer Jamey Ratcliff
summary: Restaurant and brewery owners Jennifer and Jamey Ratcliff share their experience hiring Sarah as a co-host for their Airbnb condo. The episode provides both owner and co-host perspectives on what makes a successful partnership. Their experience offers practical insights for busy owners considering hiring help.
keyInsight: Busy property owners with multiple businesses can successfully scale their STR operations by hiring co-hosts with clearly defined roles.

title: Kelly Rauch
summary: Kelly Rauch returns to discuss creating a dedicated website for short-term rentals in addition to platform listings. Having a personal website helps build brand identity and can drive direct bookings. This complements her previous advice on social media marketing strategies.
keyInsight: A dedicated property website creates an additional revenue channel beyond Airbnb and establishes stronger brand presence for luxury rentals.

title: Annette + Sarah
summary: This episode emphasizes keeping all bookings—even family and repeat guests—within platform systems like Airbnb. Taking cash, PayPal, or Venmo payments removes critical protections and creates liability issues. The hassle and risk of off-platform bookings far outweigh any perceived benefits.
keyInsight: All bookings must go through the platform to maintain insurance coverage, liability protection, and avoid serious legal and financial risks.

title: Annette + Sarah
summary: The hosts address the common challenge of strong weekend bookings but weak weekday occupancy. They share strategies to increase mid-week bookings and overall profitability. The focus is on balancing guest experience with running a profitable business throughout the week.
keyInsight: Strategic weekday pricing and targeting can transform underutilized weekdays into profitable bookings, significantly improving overall revenue.

title: Joseph Michelli
summary: Joseph Michelli, author of 'The Airbnb Way,' shares insights on exceptional hospitality and customer experience. His internationally recognized expertise translates Airbnb's success principles to any rental property. The conversation focuses on creating joyful experiences that differentiate properties in the marketplace.
keyInsight: Applying proven hospitality principles from Airbnb's success model can elevate any short-term rental's guest experience and business performance.

title: Kelly Rauch
summary: Kelly Rauch discusses building and leveraging email lists to maintain high occupancy rates. She covers effective methods for capturing guest emails and creating valuable email content. Email marketing complements social media and website strategies for comprehensive rental marketing.
keyInsight: Building an email list of past and potential guests creates a direct marketing channel for driving repeat bookings and maintaining occupancy.

title: Jesse Gross
summary: Jesse Gross, CEO of property management company Makomi, addresses common 'what if' fears for new hosts. Topics include handling parties, guest injuries, and other challenging scenarios. His multi-property management experience provides reassurance and practical solutions for worried prospective hosts.
keyInsight: Understanding how to handle worst-case scenarios before they happen reduces fear and prepares hosts to respond professionally to any situation.

title: Danny Rusteen
summary: Former Airbnb employee Danny Rusteen shares insider knowledge from his time in accounting and host marketing roles at Airbnb. He provides actionable tips from his book on optimizing listings to increase visibility and bookings on the platform.
keyInsight: Learning optimization strategies from someone who worked inside Airbnb's host acquisition team can give hosts a competitive advantage in listing visibility and booking conversion.

title: What Is Rental Arbitrage & Should You Do It?
summary: Annette and Sarah explain rental arbitrage as a business growth strategy where hosts lease properties to operate as STRs without purchasing. They discuss the benefits, risks, and their personal perspectives to help listeners evaluate if this model suits their business goals.
keyInsight: Rental arbitrage can enable STR business growth without capital investment in property ownership, but carries distinct risks that require careful evaluation of lease terms and local regulations.

title: How to Bounce Back When You Let Your Guests Down
summary: The hosts share personal experiences of hosting mistakes and their recovery strategies to reassure listeners that errors are inevitable. The episode emphasizes that guest satisfaction depends more on how problems are handled than on perfect execution.
keyInsight: Your response to mistakes matters more than the mistakes themselves—swift, empathetic problem resolution can turn disappointed guests into loyal advocates.

title: How to Make Your Airbnb as Safe as Possible
summary: Justin Ford, Director of Safety at Breezeway, discusses the critical importance of property safety and host liability. He provides operational frameworks for maintaining safe vacation rental properties and preventing incidents.
keyInsight: Property safety is a non-negotiable host responsibility that requires proactive maintenance systems, proper insurance, and documented safety protocols to protect both guests and your business.

title: Different Worlds, Same Mission: Airbnb Advice from a Vacation Rental Expert- with Sharon Keefe
summary: Sharon Keefe, a vacation rental management expert with 14 years of experience, shares professional strategies for running STRs more efficiently and profitably. She bridges the gap between traditional vacation rental management and Airbnb hosting, revealing shared missions and dispelling misconceptions.
keyInsight: Professional vacation rental management practices can be adapted by Airbnb hosts to improve operational efficiency, guest satisfaction, and profitability.

title: 7 Ways to Make Money in the STR Industry if You're a Stager or Designer
summary: Annette and Sarah outline seven revenue streams for stagers and designers in the STR industry, promoting income diversification. The episode targets both hosts with design skills and design professionals looking to enter the STR market.
keyInsight: Design and staging expertise can be monetized in multiple ways within the STR industry beyond just furnishing your own properties.

title: 8 Danger Zones in a Short Term Rental and How to Avoid Them- with Justin Ford
summary: Justin Ford returns to identify eight specific danger zones in STRs and provide concrete avoidance strategies. This tactical episode focuses on proactive hazard identification and mitigation for host liability protection.
keyInsight: Identifying and systematically addressing the eight most common danger zones in STRs prevents guest injuries and protects hosts from catastrophic liability—especially critical for properties with pools and recreational features.

title: The REAL Challenges of Hosting… Are you up for it?
summary: The hosts candidly discuss the reality of "hosting fatigue" and the ongoing challenges hosts face to set realistic expectations. By preparing listeners for inevitable difficulties, they help hosts build resilience and sustainability into their operations.
keyInsight: Anticipating and mentally preparing for hosting challenges before they arrive is essential to avoiding burnout and building a sustainable STR business.

title: Why Raising the Bar Matters- with Sharon Keefe
summary: Sharon Keefe returns to discuss why elevating industry standards benefits all hosts and communities. She emphasizes the shared mission of vacation rental and STR hosts to operate professionally and build community support.
keyInsight: Raising operational standards across the STR industry improves community acceptance and ensures the long-term viability of short-term rentals in residential neighborhoods.

title: From Flipper to Short Term Rentals- with Becky Rhey
summary: House flipper Becky Rhey shares her transition into STR hosting, revealing how she sources decor, collaborates with local businesses, and monetizes her space through photography bookings. Her design-forward approach demonstrates how flipping skills translate to successful STR hosting.
keyInsight: Transitioning from house flipping to STR hosting leverages existing design and renovation skills while creating ongoing revenue instead of one-time sale profits.

title: Matthew Garsky
summary: Professional photographer Matthew Garsky, hired by Airbnb for property photography, shares best practices for showcasing short-term rentals through high-quality images. Quality photography is essential for attracting guests and commanding premium rates. Investment in professional photography directly impacts booking conversion rates.
keyInsight: Professional photography is a non-negotiable investment for luxury STR properties, as listing images are the primary driver of booking decisions and justify premium pricing.

title: Steve Trover
summary: Steve Trover shares insights from scaling a vacation rental management company to over 350 properties and 100 employees. He focuses on identifying, hiring, and retaining the right people for the right roles. The episode covers strategic considerations for hosts looking to grow from side hustle to full-time business.
keyInsight: Successful scaling requires systematic approaches to hiring and placing people in roles that match their strengths, not just rapid property acquisition.

title: Tactical Things You Can Do Tomorrow To Raise Revenue
summary: Sharon Keefe provides actionable tactics to increase short-term rental revenue immediately. She emphasizes properly compensating yourself for services provided to avoid burnout while growing sustainably. The episode focuses on simple, implementable strategies that don't require major operational changes.
keyInsight: Hosts often undercharge by not accounting for all services they provide, leading to burnout and unsustainable business models that can be corrected with immediate tactical pricing adjustments.

title: Dryer Safety in Your Short Term Rental
summary: Justin Ford, former US Coast Guard safety officer and vacation rental safety expert, covers critical dryer safety considerations for STR hosts. Dryer fires are a preventable but serious risk in rental properties with high turnover and frequent laundry use. Proper maintenance and safety protocols protect guests, property, and business liability.
keyInsight: Dryer maintenance and lint removal are critical safety issues that many hosts overlook, yet dryer fires pose significant liability and property damage risks in high-turnover rentals.

title: How to Properly Insure your Short-Term Rental or Business
summary: Darren Pettyjohn from Proper Insurance explains specialized insurance products designed for vacation and short-term rentals. Standard homeowner policies often don't cover STR activity, leaving hosts exposed to significant financial risk. Proper coverage protects hosts, guests, and properties regardless of ownership structure.
keyInsight: Standard homeowner insurance does not cover short-term rental activity, making specialized STR insurance essential to avoid catastrophic financial exposure from guest injuries or property damage.

title: Airbnb Gets Back to Its Roots: Resources for Hosts during the Pandemic
summary: Annette and Sarah discuss Airbnb's response to the COVID-19 pandemic, including the $250 million host support fund and Superhost Relief Fund. The episode covers available resources for hosts navigating unprecedented cancellations and uncertainty. They provide guidance on accessing support programs during the crisis.
keyInsight: During the pandemic, Airbnb provided financial relief programs for hosts, demonstrating the platform's willingness to support hosts during unprecedented industry disruptions.

title: 9 Ways to Pivot Your Short-Term Rental
summary: Annette and Sarah outline nine strategies for pivoting STR properties during slow seasons, major local events, or unexpected circumstances. The advice is designed to be timeless and applicable to any rapid market change. Flexibility and creative repositioning help hosts maintain revenue during challenging periods.
keyInsight: Successful STR hosts need contingency plans and the ability to pivot their property positioning quickly in response to market changes, seasonal fluctuations, or unexpected events.

title: Is Mid-Term the New Short-Term?
summary: The hosts explore mid-term rentals (typically 30+ days) as an alternative or complement to traditional short-term stays. Mid-term rentals offer different guest profiles, more stable occupancy, and less turnover. The episode covers platforms and strategies for capturing this growing market segment.
keyInsight: Mid-term rentals (30+ days) provide an important revenue diversification strategy with lower turnover costs and more stable occupancy during uncertain market conditions.

title: Building an Epic Short-Term Rental Business
summary: Steph Utterback of EpicBnb shares her approach to building a hospitality company specializing in design, management, and consulting. She discusses property selection criteria, team development, and working with local associations to strengthen the industry. Her integrated approach combines design excellence with operational efficiency.
keyInsight: Building a successful STR management company requires strategic property selection, strong team development, and active engagement with local industry associations to create sustainable competitive advantages.

title: Creating an Unforgettable Airbnb Experience: Star Wars Edition
summary: Bryndee Barton from Loma Homes discusses creating highly-themed experiential properties, including a Star Wars-themed rental. She covers the extra work involved in themed design, finding investors for unique concepts, and enhanced staging requirements. Themed properties can command premium rates but require significant upfront investment and ongoing maintenance.
keyInsight: Themed experiential properties can differentiate your listing and justify premium pricing, but require substantial design investment, meticulous staging, and finding investors who understand the niche market appeal.

title: Justin Ford
summary: Safety expert Justin Ford discusses how COVID-19 has transformed cleaning from a routine task into a critical safety concern for STR hosts. The episode addresses guest safety fears and outlines protocols to make properties as safe as possible during the pandemic. Hosts must now communicate cleaning as a safety measure to build guest confidence.
keyInsight: In the post-COVID world, cleaning is no longer just about appearance—it's a fundamental safety requirement that directly impacts guest booking decisions.

title: 5 Ways to Pivot Your Airbnb During Downtime
summary: Annette and Sarah outline five productive ways to use slow periods or downtime to improve your STR property and business. This includes tackling deferred maintenance, updating systems, and implementing improvements that are difficult during busy periods. Downtime becomes an opportunity for strategic enhancement rather than lost income.
keyInsight: Downtime should be viewed as investment time—use slow periods strategically to complete improvements that will increase bookings and revenue when demand returns.

title: Short-Term Rental Tips from a Superhost + Design Influencer- with Catherine Williamson
summary: Catherine Williamson shares how she and her husband identified a market gap for well-designed STR spaces in Columbus, Ohio, and scaled from renting a single room to a full property portfolio. She provides strategies for getting started in the rental business with a design-first approach and tips for growing over time. Their success came from combining restoration, design expertise, and hospitality passion.
keyInsight: Identifying and filling a market gap for unique, well-designed spaces can be the foundation for scaling from a single room to a successful STR portfolio.

title: The Hosts of HGTV's 'Stay or Sell' Open Their First Short-Term Rental- with Brad & Heather Fox
summary: Brad and Heather Fox share their journey of launching their first STR while running two businesses and filming an HGTV show. They discuss factors that influenced their property purchase decision and strategies for standing out in a competitive market. Their design and real estate background informed their approach to creating a distinctive listing.
keyInsight: Standing out in the STR market requires intentional property selection and leveraging your unique professional expertise to create a differentiated guest experience.

title: What if We Get Another Stay-at-Home Order This Fall? How to Prepare- with Steve Trover
summary: Vacation rental veteran Steve Trover (20+ years experience) discusses how to prepare for potential future stay-at-home orders and COVID-19 second waves. The episode focuses on proactive planning and business continuity strategies now that hosts understand pandemic risks. Preparation includes financial planning, operational adjustments, and technology solutions for remote management.
keyInsight: Having experienced one shutdown, STR hosts must now build contingency plans and financial reserves to weather potential future disruptions rather than being caught unprepared again.

title: Why Aligning with Your Clients is Essential to Your Business
summary: This episode emphasizes the critical but often-overlooked topic of choosing the right clients when building a co-hosting business. Every property added to your portfolio is essentially a separate business, requiring careful vetting to ensure client goals align with yours. Success in co-hosting depends on being intentional and selective about which property owners you partner with.
keyInsight: Each co-hosting client represents a separate business relationship—choosing clients whose goals align with yours is more important than rapid portfolio growth.

title: Co-Hosting From Part-Time to Full-Time Salary & Beyond
summary: Annette and Sarah break down the exact numbers and time investment required to build a co-hosting business from supplemental income to full-time career replacement. The episode provides concrete financial models showing how income scales with property count and effort. Co-hosting offers a low-barrier entry into the STR world with significant income potential.
keyInsight: Co-hosting provides a clear path from supplemental to full-time income with specific, calculable financial milestones based on property count and hours invested.

title: How Hostfully Can Help You Reach More Customers & Guarantee a Great Guest Experience- with Margot Schmorak
summary: Hostfully CEO Margot Schmorak explains how their property management platform automates guest communications, manages multi-channel distribution, and integrates with other vacation rental tools. The software helps hosts of all sizes streamline operations and get properties in front of more potential guests. Key features include guidebooks, automated messaging, and reporting tools.
keyInsight: Property management software like Hostfully enables hosts to automate repetitive tasks and distribute across multiple platforms, freeing time to focus on guest experience and business growth.

title: Offering Concierge Services- with Meghan Alfonso
summary: Meghan Alfonso, founder of concierge company Girl About Town, discusses how offering concierge services can elevate guest experience while generating additional revenue. The episode covers which services to offer, building local business partnerships for referrals, and handling operational challenges. Concierge services are an accessible way to differentiate your property and increase income.
keyInsight: Concierge services provide a dual benefit—elevating the luxury guest experience while creating an additional revenue stream through curated local experiences and services.

title: Why You Should Get a Cleaning Certification for Your Rental Property
summary: Jill Mason from VRScheduler discusses her new cleaning certification program and why formal cleaning training benefits both hosts and guests. Getting certified provides verifiable proof of proper cleaning protocols, increasing guest confidence and potentially justifying premium pricing. The certification demonstrates commitment to professional standards in an era where cleaning is a primary guest concern.
keyInsight: Cleaning certification transforms an invisible back-of-house operation into a marketable credential that builds guest trust and differentiates your property in a safety-conscious market.

title: 5 Overlooked Aspects of a Management Contract
summary: This episode explores five commonly overlooked points in rental management agreements that are critical for both property owners and managers to understand. The hosts emphasize the importance of carefully structuring contracts to set yourself up for success, whether you're managing properties for others or hiring a manager for your own STR.
keyInsight: Understanding management contract details is essential whether you plan to hire a manager or manage properties for others, as these agreements form the foundation of successful business relationships.

title: How to Market & Brand Your Short Term Rental Business with Tayler Smith
summary: Tayler Smith shares tactical marketing and branding strategies from her family's portfolio of unique properties (train car, plane, automobile conversions). The episode covers specific tools and techniques including hashtag research, maintaining brand consistency across multiple properties, and strategic marketing investments using platforms like Squarespace, Tezza, VSCO, and Snapseed.
keyInsight: Strong, consistent branding allows multiple unique properties to stand together cohesively while each maintaining its individual character, making tactical use of hashtags and visual editing tools essential for effective social media marketing.

title: Live Airbnb Coaching with Ashley Wilson
summary: This live coaching session with Ashley Wilson, host of Pink Palm Hideaway and Fairview Cottage, demonstrates how to identify opportunities to increase earnings on existing properties. The hosts walk through specific questions and areas where hosts should look to optimize their listings and operations.
keyInsight: Learning what questions to ask about your own property through observing coaching sessions with other hosts can dramatically speed up your journey to profitability.

title: How to Close Down Listings Efficiently and Ethically Without the Overwhelm with Tracey Northcott
summary: Tracey Northcott, a nearly decade-long Airbnb Superhost and consultant, shares strategies for closing down STR listings efficiently and ethically. She discusses how to focus on properties with the best ROI while properly shutting down others, covering the legal, operational, and guest communication aspects of the process.
keyInsight: Knowing how to properly close listings is as important as launching them, requiring strategic focus on properties that deliver the best returns while handling closures safely and ethically.

title: Pivot From the Overnight Short-Term Rental Strategy to the Niche of Hourly Location Rentals with Ashley & Brett Nobles
summary: Ashley and Brett Nobles share how they've diversified their rental business beyond nightly stays to include hourly location rentals for photo shoots, video production, and corporate events. With over 800 bookings and clients like Google, Facebook, Amazon, and Netflix, they explain how to prep spaces and price location rentals differently than overnight stays.
keyInsight: Diversifying into hourly location rentals for photo shoots and corporate events can significantly increase revenue, but requires different pricing strategies and liability considerations than traditional overnight STR bookings.

title: What to Consider When Hosting Photo Shoots in Your Rental
summary: Building on the previous episode about location rentals, this episode dives deeper into the specific considerations for hosting photo shoots, videos, and corporate meetings. The hosts emphasize that charging only your nightly rate for location rentals leaves money on the table and creates serious liability issues.
keyInsight: Charging your standard nightly rate for photo shoots and location rentals significantly undervalues your property and exposes you to liability risks that require different pricing and protection strategies.

title: Attracting Influencers to Your Short-term Rental with Levi Kelly
summary: YouTuber Levi Kelly, who has toured over 70 unique Airbnbs and gained 150k subscribers in one year, shares what makes properties attractive to influencers and content creators. He discusses how working with influencers can amplify your property's reach and what characteristics make an STR "influencer-worthy."
keyInsight: Creating an exceptional, unique property that appeals to content creators can generate massive exposure through influencer partnerships, but the property must truly be all-around superb to warrant their attention.

title: How to Price Your Properties for Success with Meg Park
summary: Meg Park, who has worked in vacation rentals since 2007, provides practical pricing education covering how to balance pricing for short versus long stays and how far in advance to manage pricing. Her marketing background and extensive industry experience inform strategies for optimizing revenue through strategic pricing decisions.
keyInsight: Strategic pricing that balances short-term and long-term stay optimization, with appropriate booking window management, is fundamental to maximizing revenue and occupancy rates.

title: Stage to Rent Q&A
summary: This Q&A session addresses common questions about furnishing and designing short-term rentals in preparation for the hosts' Stage to Rent Academy course launch. The answers provide value for designers, stagers, owners, and hosts looking to create profitable, well-designed rental spaces.
keyInsight: Professional staging and design strategies for STRs differ from traditional residential design and require specific knowledge that benefits owners, hosts, and design professionals alike.

title: The Role of the Inspector
summary: This episode introduces the critical but often overlooked role of the inspector in the turnover process, explaining how this position ensures properties are truly guest-ready. The hosts describe how implementing an inspector role can be a game-changer for businesses at any stage, from single properties to large portfolios.
keyInsight: Adding an inspector role to verify property readiness between the cleaning team and guest arrival is a game-changing operational step that ensures quality control and prevents negative guest experiences.

title: Sarah Nie Karen Gleason
summary: Sarah Nie and Karen Gleason of POP Rentals share their approach to managing vacation rentals in western North Carolina by continuously experimenting with new strategies. They discuss combining technology expertise with real estate experience to remain competitive and increase revenue. Their philosophy emphasizes never stopping experimentation to grow and adapt the business.
keyInsight: Continuous experimentation with different strategies and technologies is essential to staying competitive and maximizing revenue in the short-term rental market.

title: Annette + Sarah
summary: This episode addresses how to provide constructive feedback to turnover teams without damaging relationships. The hosts emphasize that turnover teams operate their own businesses and want to keep hosts happy, just as hosts want to keep guests satisfied. The focus is on communicating improvement needs professionally while maintaining good working relationships.
keyInsight: Frame feedback to your turnover team around guest experience rather than personal demands, remembering they run their own business and want you as a satisfied client.

title: Robert Abasolo
summary: Robert Abasolo, a tiny home builder and Airbnb Superhost, shares his journey from building tiny homes to becoming a YouTube Creator on the Rise while running glamp listings. He provides transparent financial insights about rental income and offers advice for both new hosts and those looking to scale. His story demonstrates how content creation and STR hosting can work together.
keyInsight: Building a content platform like YouTube alongside your STR business can create multiple revenue streams while marketing your properties and establishing authority in the space.

title: Annette + Sarah
summary: The hosts discuss how to create and communicate house rules effectively without seeming overly strict or unwelcoming. Clear policies benefit both hosts and guests by setting proper expectations and protecting the property. The episode covers what rules to include and how to present them in a guest-friendly manner.
keyInsight: Clear house rules aren't about control—they're about setting expectations that protect your property while ensuring guests know exactly what to expect for a better experience.

title: Kate Buhler
summary: Kate Buhler, a luxury sales and service consultant with 25+ years in hospitality, shares strategies for creating exceptional Airbnb experiences during COVID-19 and beyond. She discusses staying ahead of trends and adapting to the "next normal" while maintaining high service standards. Her expertise helps hosts understand how to thrive during challenging times by focusing on meaningful guest experiences.
keyInsight: Adapting to current trends and situations while maintaining luxury service standards allows hosts to turn challenges into opportunities for growth and differentiation.

title: Tori Seth Bolt
summary: Tori and Seth Bolt, Superhosts of the #1 Airbnb in South Carolina (Bolt Farm Treehouse), share how they create inspiring luxury nature retreats focused on transformative travel. With over 2,000 guests from 25 countries, 650+ five-star reviews, and over $500K in revenue, they reveal strategies for creating meaningful experiences that generate lifelong customers. They discuss their approach to unique property design and exceptional hospitality.
keyInsight: Creating transformative, meaningful experiences rather than just providing accommodation turns guests into lifelong customers and generates exceptional reviews and revenue.

title: Katie Raboy
summary: Katie Raboy shares her journey from self-managing one cabin in March 2020 to launching The Cabin Collection management company by September 2020. She discusses overcoming lack of confidence, taking action before feeling fully ready, and setting boundaries to prevent burnout. Her story focuses on the mental and emotional aspects of starting and scaling a STR business.
keyInsight: Taking action before you feel completely ready and setting clear boundaries for mental health are essential for building confidence and avoiding burnout when starting a rental business.

title: Simon DeSwaan
summary: Simon DeSwaan brings 15 years of Four Seasons hotel experience to his short-term rental hosting. As both a hospitality executive recruiter and Superhost, he shares insider tricks from top hotels and restaurants that directly apply to STR businesses. His insights bridge the gap between luxury hotel standards and vacation rental hosting.
keyInsight: Applying proven luxury hotel hospitality principles to your short-term rental can significantly elevate the guest experience and differentiate your property from competitors.

title: Annette + Sarah
summary: The hosts review their top 5 most-listened-to episodes of 2020, explaining why each resonated with listeners. This recap episode provides an opportunity for new listeners to catch foundational content and for returning listeners to revisit key concepts. It serves as a curated guide to the year's most valuable content.
keyInsight: Revisiting top-performing content helps reinforce key concepts and ensures you haven't missed foundational knowledge that resonated most with the host community.

title: Remote Airbnb Hosting and Other House Hacks
summary: Zeona McIntyre, an Airbnb host since 2012 who owns seven homes and manages 15 properties, shares strategies for remote hosting and house hacking. She discusses how she achieved financial independence in just over two years and transitioned from property management to helping investors with real estate. Her expertise covers both operational tactics for remote management and investment strategies for building a portfolio.
keyInsight: House hacking and remote hosting strategies can accelerate the path to financial independence, allowing you to scale from one property to a portfolio in just a few years.

title: Debbie Michael Campbell
summary: The Senior Nomads, veteran Airbnb guests who have traveled the world, share insights on what makes listings attractive to potential guests and what services matter most. They discuss guest expectations around amenities, services, and important information like healthcare and emergency contacts that hosts should provide.
keyInsight: Seasoned guests value clear communication about services, amenities, and essential information like healthcare access more than flashy features.

title: Justin Ford - How to Make Your Short-Term Rental Safe: Top 5 Preventable STR Accidents from 2020
summary: Justin Ford from Breezeway reviews the top preventable accidents in STRs from 2020, including carbon monoxide leaks, fire hazards, deck collapses, and pool drownings. The episode provides actionable safety checklists and certification programs to ensure properties meet safety standards and protect both guests and hosts from liability.
keyInsight: Proactive safety measures including CO alarms, pool safety protocols, and structural inspections are non-negotiable for preventing liability and protecting guest lives.

title: Kelvin Mah - SEO Optimization Tips for Your Airbnb
summary: Kelvin Mah, founder of RankBreeze, explains how to optimize Airbnb listings for better search rankings and conversions to increase bookings. He covers SEO strategies specific to short-term rental platforms that help great properties get in front of more potential guests.
keyInsight: Optimizing your Airbnb listing for platform-specific SEO is essential to getting your property seen by more guests and increasing booking rates.

title: Amy Corbett - Create a Space Where Everyone Belongs
summary: Amy Corbett of All Belong Collective shares how her diverse family inspired her to create STR spaces where everyone feels they belong. She discusses scaling from solo operation to team management, pricing strategies, and incorporating inclusive values into property design and operations.
keyInsight: A strong mission and 'why' behind your hosting business will sustain you through challenges and differentiate your brand in a competitive market.

title: Short-Term Rentals are Not Just About Heads in Beds
summary: Annette and Sarah argue against the 'heads-in-beds' mentality of maximizing occupancy at the expense of guest experience. They outline non-negotiable standards for hosts and property managers who want to remain competitive and deliver exceptional hospitality rather than just providing a place to sleep.
keyInsight: Prioritizing guest experience and quality over maximizing capacity is essential for long-term competitiveness and success in the luxury STR market.

title: Julie George - You Can Become a Million Dollar Host
summary: Julie George, author of 'Million Dollar Host,' shares how she scaled from one Airbnb listing in 2016 to managing 130 properties with over $8 million in bookings in under three years. She discusses her business structure, scaling strategies, lessons learned, and why she eventually sold her management company.
keyInsight: Rapid scaling in STR management requires systematic business structures and processes that can support growth without sacrificing quality.

title: Amanda Williams - Leveraging Passive Income for Financial & Time Freedom
summary: Amanda Williams, 'The Traveling Realtor,' manages a 15-property Airbnb portfolio remotely while living abroad. She teaches real estate agents and hosts how to create passive income streams that provide time and location freedom through strategic property management and business systems.
keyInsight: Building passive income through STRs requires systematizing operations so the business can run successfully without your constant physical presence.

title: Chip Conley - Hospitality Tips from an Airbnb Legend
summary: Chip Conley, former Head of Global Hospitality at Airbnb and boutique hotel entrepreneur, shares what made him successful in hotels and what he brought to Airbnb's global strategy. He discusses translating traditional hospitality excellence to the short-term rental world and the importance of continuous learning in the industry.
keyInsight: Applying professional hospitality principles from the hotel industry to short-term rentals elevates the guest experience and creates lasting competitive advantage.

title: Merilee Karr - Creating a Stronger STR Industry Together
summary: Merilee Karr, founder of UnderTheDoormat and chairperson of the UK Short Term Accommodation Association, discusses professionalizing the STR industry and staying ahead of government regulation. She shares insights on building scalable businesses, creating great guest experiences, and working collectively to strengthen industry standards.
keyInsight: Treating short-term rentals professionally and engaging proactively with regulation helps legitimize the industry and protect hosting businesses long-term.

title: Wil Slickers - How STRs Can Get a Leg Up on the Hotel Industry
summary: Wil Slickers, hospitality podcast host and co-founder of Recreation Rentals, explores what short-term rentals can do better than chain hotels. Drawing from his hospitality background and podcast interviews, he identifies unique advantages STRs have over traditional hotels in delivering memorable guest experiences.
keyInsight: Short-term rentals can outcompete hotels by offering personalized, authentic local experiences and flexibility that standardized hotel chains cannot replicate.

title: Julie Gates
summary: Julie Gates specializes in rentals of 30+ days and has grown to over 30 properties by incorporating Airbnb into her long-term rental business. She discusses considerations for longer-term bookings, guest sourcing, and corporate booking strategies. The episode contrasts short-term versus long-term rental approaches.
keyInsight: Incorporating longer-term stays (30+ days) can provide stable income and reduce turnover costs while still leveraging short-term rental platforms like Airbnb.

title: Jeffrey Iloulian
summary: Jeffrey Iloulian, with experience operating 250+ vacation rentals, created HostGPO, a Group Purchasing Organization that helps STR owners source supplies more easily and cheaply. The discussion covers how joining a GPO can reduce operating costs and streamline procurement for hosts and property managers.
keyInsight: Joining a Group Purchasing Organization can significantly reduce supply costs and operational overhead by leveraging collective buying power.

title: Following the Journey from Idea to Income Property (Part 1)- with Shannon Leyh
summary: Shannon Leyh shares her vulnerable, honest journey from deciding to enter the STR business to purchasing her first property. She provides transparent financial numbers and real-world insights into what it takes to launch a short-term rental, with part two covering the outcome.
keyInsight: Following a real host's complete journey from idea to launch provides invaluable transparent insights into the actual financial and operational requirements of starting an STR business.

title: Following the Journey from Idea to Income Property (Part 2), with Shannon Leyh
summary: Part two of Shannon Leyh's journey reveals the actual outcomes and results after launching her Snowshoe, West Virginia rental property. This episode provides closure on the financial and operational results of her first STR investment.
keyInsight: Hearing the complete outcome of a new host's journey—not just the optimistic beginning—provides realistic expectations for launching your first STR property.

title: Focusing on Preventative Maintenance, with Andrew Kaiser
summary: Andrew Kaiser of MendBnb discusses the top five preventative maintenance issues all hosts should address to improve guest experience and avoid costly reactive repairs. Being proactive rather than reactive with maintenance protects both property value and guest satisfaction.
keyInsight: Preventative maintenance is essential for luxury properties with pools and amenities—proactively addressing the top maintenance issues prevents guest disappointments and expensive emergency repairs.

title: Recognizing the Lifetime Value of Your Guests
summary: Annette and Sarah reflect on their biggest hosting mistakes, particularly underestimating guest lifetime value beyond a single reservation. Over-relying on automation creates "turn and burn" experiences that leave significant money on the table through lost repeat bookings, referrals, and relationship-building opportunities.
keyInsight: The true value of each guest extends far beyond their initial reservation—building genuine relationships drives repeat bookings, referrals, and long-term revenue that automation alone cannot capture.

title: Using Rental Property to Fund Your Vacation Home with Larry Nettles
summary: Larry Nettles shares his relatable journey of buying his first STR investment property in St. Croix with no prior experience, with the goal of funding his own Caribbean vacations. His story demonstrates what's achievable within a few years for new hosts entering the market.
keyInsight: Starting with zero experience, strategic STR investment can fund your own vacation goals while building a profitable rental business within just a few years.

title: 7 Tips to Ensure Pool & Spa Safety with Justin Ford
summary: Safety expert Justin Ford provides seven essential tips for hosts with pools and spas to ensure guest safety as summer approaches. The episode references a $11.6 million verdict against an STR owner, emphasizing safety barriers, water watchers, and drowning detection technology to manage liability.
keyInsight: For luxury properties with pools and water features, implementing comprehensive safety measures including barriers, monitoring systems, and clear guest communication is legally and ethically critical to prevent catastrophic liability.

title: Giving a Historic Home New Life with James Gray
summary: James Gray transformed Farrand Hall, a historic Michigan estate on the National Register, into a multi-faceted business including STR, events venue, weddings, and unique chef-hosted dinners. He discusses the challenges of turnover, diversifying revenue streams, and building a property brand beyond just nightly rentals.
keyInsight: Historic or unique properties can maximize revenue by diversifying beyond nightly rentals into events, dining experiences, and photoshoots, creating multiple income streams from a single asset.

title: How FemmeBnb Helps Women Travel Safe & Comfortably with Yaa Birago
summary: Yaa Birago created FemmeBnb, a platform exclusively for women renting to women travelers, addressing safety concerns in solo travel. The platform includes AI-powered trip planning and a pay-it-forward initiative providing menstrual products to girls in Africa, combining hospitality with social impact.
keyInsight: Niche platforms targeting specific traveler demographics like solo women address underserved safety concerns, though may have limited applicability for hosts focused on luxury family or group properties.

title: Start Your STR Business with an Investment Tribe with Travis Smith
summary: Travis Smith, founder of Tribevest, explains how to start a short-term rental through group investment rather than solo ownership. The platform allows multiple investors to pool resources and co-own STR properties, making entry into the market more accessible. This approach reduces individual financial burden and risk while enabling faster market entry.
keyInsight: Group investment through platforms like Tribevest provides an accessible entry point into STR ownership by pooling capital and distributing risk among multiple investors.

title: Marketing Your Brand Through WiFi Portals with Arthur Colker
summary: Arthur Colker of StayFi demonstrates how WiFi portals can be used to brand your property, capture guest emails, and drive direct bookings even for OTA guests. The service creates a custom WiFi login experience that collects guest data while providing better connectivity. This is critical for building a direct booking funnel independent of third-party platforms.
keyInsight: WiFi portals are an overlooked opportunity to capture guest email addresses from OTA bookings and convert them into future direct booking customers.

title: Outdoorsy Takes Short-Term Rentals on the Road with Matt Mitchell
summary: Matt Mitchell shares his experience renting Mercedes-Benz Sprinter campervans as short-term rentals through his business We Van Wild. He discusses the appeal of mobile accommodations, common guest questions, and how he educates travelers about van life. This represents an alternative STR model focused on vehicles rather than fixed properties.
keyInsight: Vehicle-based STRs like camper vans represent a niche market with lower barriers to entry but require different operational considerations than traditional property rentals.

title: Cash Pad, TV Show Renovation & the Austin STR Market with Lauren Noble
summary: Lauren Noble, an Austin Superhost and ICU nurse, discusses her experience having her Boho Bungalow featured on CNBC's "Cash Pad" renovation show. She shares insights about the competitive Austin STR market and how a side-gig hosting business evolved beyond her initial expectations. The episode provides market-specific insights for Texas hosts.
keyInsight: Media exposure through TV shows can elevate a property's profile, but successful hosting in competitive markets like Austin requires treating it as a serious business rather than just a side project.

title: Start Boosting Your Direct Bookings Today with Mark Simpson
summary: Mark Simpson of Boostly, who has coached over 1,000 hospitality businesses, shares strategies for reducing OTA dependence by driving direct bookings. He focuses on practical systems that help hosts capture guests directly through their own channels, reducing platform fees and increasing control. His mission is to help hosts break free from OTA dominance.
keyInsight: Building a direct booking strategy is essential for long-term STR profitability and business control, reducing the 15-20% fees paid to OTAs while building owned guest relationships.

title: The Hidden Expense of Your Airbnb
summary: Annette and Sarah address the often-overlooked cost of time in STR hosting, which is difficult to quantify but critically important for true profitability. They discuss the emotional aspects of valuing your time and the reality of being on-call 24/7 as a host. Understanding time costs helps hosts make better decisions about outsourcing and scaling.
keyInsight: The cost of your time is the most overlooked expense in STR hosting and must be factored into profitability calculations to make informed business decisions about growth and delegation.

title: Five Commonly Overlooked Cleaning Opportunities
summary: Annette and Sarah identify five frequently missed cleaning tasks that can prevent guest complaints and emergency trips to the property. They emphasize preventative cleaning measures and recommend specific products like Bar Keepers Friend and systems like Breezeway. Smart cleaning protocols save time and maintain property condition long-term.
keyInsight: Preventative cleaning of commonly overlooked areas prevents guest complaints and reduces emergency maintenance trips, ultimately saving time and protecting reviews.

title: Make Deck Safety a Priority with Justin Ford
summary: Justin Ford, a safety expert with coastguard training and firefighting experience, addresses the epidemic of deck collapses in the US and provides actionable safety measures. Having experienced tragedy at one of his own properties, he speaks from direct experience about preventative maintenance. Deck safety is a critical liability issue for STR hosts with outdoor spaces.
keyInsight: Deck collapses are a preventable epidemic that poses serious liability risks for STR hosts, requiring regular professional inspections and proactive maintenance, especially for properties with elevated outdoor spaces.

title: Hiring a Team That Works with You with Taylor Arbaugh
summary: Taylor Arbaugh, Sarah's property coordinator at The Cliffs Hocking Hills, discusses how to build a team with shared values and attention to detail. As a local mom without property management background, she demonstrates that industry experience matters less than alignment and trainability. The episode provides practical insights on finding and developing reliable team members.
keyInsight: Hiring local team members who share your ethos and attention to detail is more important than industry experience, and proper training can develop excellent property coordinators from non-traditional backgrounds.

title: Going All In on Short-Term Rentals with A-Frame Ranch Owner Callie Witcher
summary: Callie Witcher, a Superhost in Fredericksburg, TX, shares how she and her husband built three A-frame STRs from the ground up with no prior industry experience. She discusses market selection, the decision to build rather than buy, and managing the stress of aggressive scaling. Her approach demonstrates the viability of jumping into STRs with multiple properties simultaneously.
keyInsight: Building multiple purpose-built STR properties from the ground up can be a viable entry strategy in the right market, even without prior hosting experience, if you're willing to commit fully and manage the complexity.

title: Our Mistakes Making Property Offers & How to Avoid Them
summary: Annette and Sarah share their experience making their first property offer together, revealing mistakes they made that delayed the process. They discuss lessons learned about property acquisition and evolving from educators to building their own STR portfolio. The episode emphasizes transparency and learning from missteps in the buying process.
keyInsight: Taking too long to make offers on properties can cost you opportunities—decisive action is crucial when expanding your STR portfolio.

title: Buying Land & Property Using Creative Financing Options with Mike Hicks
summary: Mike Hicks, with 20+ years in real estate, shares his journey from new construction to STRs, including converting a duplex in 2016. He discusses creative financing options, pros and cons of short versus long-term rentals, and unique property concepts like building rentals inside shipping containers. The conversation provides actionable insights for hosts looking at alternative acquisition and development strategies.
keyInsight: Creative financing options and unconventional property types like shipping containers can provide entry points into the STR market that traditional approaches might miss.

title: 3 Things a Property Manager Can Focus on Now to Help Them Achieve the Best Exit with Jacobie Olin
summary: Jacobie Olin, an M&A consultant in the STR industry, discusses the often-overlooked selling phase of property ownership. He explains key financial concepts like cap rates and capital gains, and provides three actionable steps property managers can take now to maximize their property's value for a future sale. The episode focuses on long-term strategic planning beyond just buying and operating.
keyInsight: Preparing for a successful property exit should begin from day one of ownership, with specific operational and financial practices that maximize valuation when you're ready to sell.

title: 11 Things to Look for When Hiring a Co-Host
summary: This episode provides a comprehensive checklist of eleven criteria for hiring a property manager, co-host, or hosting company. Annette and Sarah help hosts recognize when it's time to delegate management responsibilities and how to ensure you find qualified help that aligns with your property standards. The practical framework helps hosts scale their operations effectively.
keyInsight: Using a systematic 11-point evaluation framework when hiring property management help protects your investment and ensures quality standards are maintained as you scale.

title: How to End a Property/Manager Relationship That's Out of Alignment
summary: Following up on hiring co-hosts, this episode addresses what to do when a property-manager relationship isn't working. Annette and Sarah discuss recognizing misalignment with your brand, trusting your instincts, and professionally ending relationships that don't serve your business goals. The guidance applies to both property managers and property owners in evaluating fit.
keyInsight: Recognizing and acting on brand misalignment early prevents long-term problems—it's better to professionally exit a relationship than compromise your portfolio's integrity.

title: A Wild Story: An Unorthodox Short-Term Rental Journey in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico
summary: Theater professional Dan Ferretti shares his unconventional path to becoming a Superhost in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, and co-hosting additional units. He discusses how his extensive personal travel experience informed his hosting approach and the unique challenges and adventures of managing an international property. The episode provides perspective on leveraging personal passions and experience in STR hosting.
keyInsight: Your personal travel experiences and professional skills from other industries can directly inform and enhance your approach to hosting short-term rentals.

title: Give & Grow: How Philanthropic Hosting Helps Communities & Businesses Alike with Chelsea Dunckley
summary: Chelsea Dunckley of Digs Co. explores how integrating philanthropy into your STR business creates positive effects across multiple dimensions. The episode discusses various ways to offer your vacation rental for charitable purposes and how this approach benefits your community, brand, and business outcomes. It provides a framework for hosts wanting to align profit with purpose.
keyInsight: Incorporating philanthropic hosting into your business model creates a positive ripple effect that simultaneously strengthens community ties and enhances your brand reputation.

title: Elevating Your STR with High-Vibe Design with Moira Sedgwick
summary: Moira Sedgwick, James Beard Awards Director and founder of A Chalet Collective, discusses the intersection of hospitality and design. She explains how to create unique, elevated experiences through intentional design choices that enhance the overall vibe of your property. The episode is essential for luxury hosts looking to differentiate through design excellence.
keyInsight: Creating a distinctive, high-vibe design experience is critical for luxury STRs to command premium rates and stand out in competitive markets.

title: What to Do When a Potential Guest is Sending Warning Flags
summary: This episode provides guidance on recognizing and responding to warning signs from potential guests during the booking process. Annette and Sarah outline Airbnb's existing verification systems, discuss additional screening tools like Safely, InsuraGuest, and Autohost, and provide dos and don'ts for maintaining safety. The practical advice helps hosts protect their properties without discriminatory practices.
keyInsight: Trusting your instincts about guest red flags while using platform verification tools and third-party screening services protects your property without violating fair housing principles.

title: Take Your Property from Overlooked to Overbooked with Brian and Kati Green
summary: Superguests Brian and Kati Green share insights from searching thousands of listings worldwide to help hosts optimize their property presentations. They focus on effective photography as the number one factor in converting browsers to bookers and provide immediately actionable tips for improving visual marketing. The episode includes unique strategies not commonly discussed in STR circles.
keyInsight: Professional, strategic photography is the single most powerful tool for converting potential guests into bookings and directly impacts your property's revenue performance.

title: Leveraging Local Expertise to Successfully Run Your Rental Business with Victoria Hawley
summary: Victoria Hawley, a Superhost managing properties in both Columbus, Ohio and Nashville, Tennessee, shares how to successfully operate STRs across multiple states. The episode emphasizes the critical importance of having boots-on-the-ground management teams with local expertise and ensuring all parties are aligned on goals. Key topics include working with multiple management teams, maximizing property performance, and navigating local STR laws and regulations.
keyInsight: Successfully managing STRs across multiple states requires local expert management teams who understand area-specific regulations and can maximize property performance.

title: Our Experiences at the 2021 Vacation Rental Managers Association International Conference in San Antonio, Texas
summary: Annette and Sarah recap their first post-COVID in-person conference at VRMA International in San Antonio. They share key takeaways including tips on effective communication, handling negative reviews, and insights from industry leaders. The episode highlights resources like Rent Responsibly, Breezeway, and HostGPO.
keyInsight: Attending industry conferences provides valuable networking opportunities and actionable strategies for improving guest communication and review management.

title: Revenue Management for the Rest of Us with Heather Richer
summary: Heather Richer, a revenue management expert with over a decade of experience, breaks down the fundamentals of revenue management for short-term rentals. She explains how hosts can understand and implement revenue strategies to steal market share and beat competition, regardless of their experience level. The episode makes revenue management accessible and actionable for all hosts.
keyInsight: Understanding revenue management fundamentals is critical for any STR host to optimize pricing, beat competition, and maximize profitability.

title: Growing a Business While Giving Back with Coconut Condos' Angie Leone
summary: Angie Leone, owner of Coconut Condos vacation rental management company in Maui, discusses recognizing when to transition from part-time hosting to full-time business by hiring staff. She shares insights on rental growth strategies, navigating Hawaii's pandemic policies, and giving back through the Dream Foundation. The episode explores the tipping point for scaling an STR business.
keyInsight: Recognizing the right time to hire help and transition from part-time to full-time STR management is crucial for sustainable business growth.

title: Lessons for STR Hosts from a Digital Nomad with Zach Busekrus
summary: Zach Busekrus, a digital nomad who stayed in Airbnbs every 2-4 weeks during COVID, reverse engineers what drives guest booking decisions. He shares insights on what actually pulls at guests' heartstrings versus what hosts assume matters, when to book, and how guests discern quality properties. This guest perspective provides invaluable intel for optimizing listings and amenities.
keyInsight: Understanding real guest priorities and booking behavior from a professional guest's perspective helps hosts optimize listings to convert more bookings.

title: Buying with the End in Mind
summary: Annette and Sarah emphasize the importance of considering your exit strategy when purchasing an STR property. While encouraging hosts to start quickly without overthinking, they stress that knowing what you'll do with the property when your STR journey ends is critical planning from day one. Life circumstances change, so having flexibility and resale options built into your purchase decision is smart business.
keyInsight: Always buy STR properties with an exit strategy in mind, considering future resale value and alternative uses even before you start hosting.

title: Renting Responsibly: Playing a Role in Your Local Regulation with Dana Lubner
summary: Dana Lubner, Head of Leadership Development at Rent Responsibly, shares how STR hosts can get involved in local regulation efforts. She serves on Denver's STR advisory committee and explains actionable ways to participate in shaping fair regulations. The episode covers building STR alliances, working with local government, and ensuring the rental industry remains accessible.
keyInsight: Proactively engaging in local STR regulation through alliances and government committees helps hosts protect their businesses and shape fair policies.

title: Looking at Airbnb's November 9, 2021 Update in Detail
summary: Annette and Sarah provide a detailed breakdown of Airbnb's November 9, 2021 platform updates to keep hosts informed and compliant. They analyze how the changes impact host operations and what actions hosts need to take. The episode ensures small business owners don't miss critical platform updates that could affect their bookings and business operations.
keyInsight: Staying current with Airbnb platform updates is essential for hosts to remain compliant, optimize their listings, and avoid operational issues.

title: Creating an Identity for Your STR Property with Stacey Rase
summary: Stacey Rase, a New Orleans area Superhost, shares how she created a unique niche by catering to brides and bridal parties at her specialty STR properties. After purchasing her first property on gut feeling three years ago, she's built a memorable brand by offering one-of-a-kind experiences for special occasions. The episode explores how finding and serving a specific niche can differentiate your STR business.
keyInsight: Creating a distinct identity and serving a specific niche market, like bridal parties, can dramatically differentiate your STR and attract premium bookings.

title: Vacation Rental Women's Summit Recap
summary: Annette, Sarah, and their Hosting Business Mastery Method members recap the Vacation Rental Women's Summit, dividing and conquering to cover maximum content. They share their biggest takeaways from the event, providing insights from multiple sessions and speakers. The episode demonstrates the power of collaborative learning and community in the STR industry.
keyInsight: Leveraging community and collaborative learning at industry events multiplies the insights and actionable strategies you can bring back to your STR business.

title: Operating an Overseas Vacation Rental Business with Lisa Byrne
summary: Lisa Byrne shares insights on managing vacation properties from another continent, operating VacationPerfect.com for over 20 years in Europe while living in North America. Key topics include remote property management systems, converting OTA guests to direct bookings on your own website, and building authentic guest relationships despite distance.
keyInsight: Successful overseas property management requires robust systems for remote operations and proactive communication to maintain guest satisfaction across time zones.

title: Our Best Episodes of 2021
summary: Annette and Sarah review the top 10 most-listened episodes of 2021, covering topics from first investments and hidden expenses to creative financing, direct bookings, and high-vibe design. The recap highlights listener priorities and provides a roadmap for catching up on essential content.
keyInsight: The most popular content focuses on financial fundamentals, creative property acquisition strategies, and elevating properties through design and direct booking strategies.

title: Real Estate Investing & the Power of Communities with Stacey St. John
summary: Stacey St. John discusses her transition from global consulting to full-time real estate investing after discovering the wealth-building potential of STRs. She emphasizes building communities and partnerships with trusted peers, sharing knowledge openly, and supporting the growth of the short-term rental industry collectively.
keyInsight: Building strong communities and partnerships with other investors accelerates learning and creates opportunities for growth without sacrificing personal time or sanity.

title: Back to the Basics: 7 Things to Review in the New Year
summary: Annette and Sarah outline seven fundamental areas hosts should review annually to ensure solid operational footing. These actionable basics help even experienced hosts reset and refocus on foundational elements often overlooked during busy seasons.
keyInsight: Regular annual reviews of basic operational systems prevent small issues from becoming major problems and ensure consistent property performance.

title: Back to the Basics: Refocusing on Guest Experience
summary: Drawing from staying at over 20 hotels and STRs, the hosts share simple, affordable, and immediately actionable improvements to enhance guest experience. They emphasize not overthinking hospitality and focusing on foundational elements that consistently delight guests.
keyInsight: The best guest experience improvements are often simple, affordable details that show thoughtfulness rather than expensive or complex additions.

title: Behind the Scenes on Our First Real Estate Deal
summary: Annette and Sarah provide a transparent look at their first joint real estate partnership, detailing how they structured the deal, their individual investment levels, and progress updates. They offer insights into co-ownership arrangements and real-time decision-making as new property owners.
keyInsight: Transparent communication about deal structure and investment contributions is essential when entering partnership-based real estate ventures.

title: Working With Influencers To Showcase Your STR Listing with Elise Armitage
summary: Elise Armitage, founder of What The Fab, discusses transitioning from corporate to full-time content creation and navigating influencer partnerships with STR properties. The conversation covers fair compensation models, appropriate collaboration terms, and leveraging social media to showcase properties effectively.
keyInsight: Influencer partnerships can amplify property visibility when structured with clear expectations about compensation, content usage rights, and mutual value exchange.

title: Breaking Down Our Sales Blitz Strategy
summary: Annette and Sarah detail their Sales Blitz method for proactively filling bookings during off-seasons without relying solely on OTAs. The strategy emphasizes community engagement, direct outreach, and taking control of your booking calendar through targeted sales efforts.
